PGC Origin – Location/Derivation: Inner mass origin from central cytoplasm = oosome
Notes: Balbiani body observed in nutritive cells pre-vitellogenesis; Oosome components initially cortical, then drawn into yolk centre by successive cleavage furrows; Nelsen (based on Claypole) wrongly referred to them as being first detected in association with coelomic sacs

PGC Origin – Location/Derivation: as for A. maritima: one region of egg contains polar granules, which are incorporated into PGCs in blastoderm stage (nuage, which partially derives from nucleus seen in PGCs); these enter yolk mass, divide, then migrate to the mesodermal gonad anlage
Embryology: Polyspermy is the rule; only one sperm becomes the functional pronucleus; 4 nuclei initially form syncytium, then superficial cleavage results in a stereoblastula
Notes: Some inner cells which get only a few cortical granules degenerate; nuage and mitochondria are perinuclear; nuage fibrous and fuzzy before gonad colonization; after gonad entry, granular nuage of nuclear origin (containing RNA but not DNA) joins fibrous nuage ; Semitransparent chorion; about 500 um egg; holoblastic cleavage after 4 cell stage; embryogenesis about 5 months

PGC Origin – Location/Derivation: Detach from blastoderm and enter yolk mass; scattered in yolk mass at blastoderm stage
Notes: Meroistic polytrophic ovaries with paired, sac-like ovaries and no discrete ovarioles; 20-30 trophocytes per oocyte
Meroistic polytrophic ovaries with paired, sac-like ovaries and no discrete ovarioles; 20-30 trophocytes per oocyte

PGC Origin – Location/Derivation: First visible in coelom of A1-A6, surrounded by mesodermal cells
Notes: Gonia contain dense bodies

PGC Origin – Location/Derivation: During superficial cleavage stage, 1 or 2 small blastomeres seen underlying segregated blastoderm; fate not followed
Notes: Cleavage similar to Symphyla, Siplopoda, Parupoda, Collembola, but different from Thysanura & Pterygota

PGC Origin – Location/Derivation: First visible on elongating germ band at P; migrate A among mesoderm cells to abdominal segments
Notes: Hard to distinguish from mesodermal cells

PGC Origin – Location/Derivation: First seen in splanchnic walls of abdominal coelomic sacs during blastokinesis = 4d AEL; no nuage visible in eggs
Notes: Gonad rudiments differentiate just before midgut epithelium in 3rd instar nymphs, A2-A6 in females, A4-A6 in males

PGC Origin – Location/Derivation: As for T. domestica (presumably – not specified explicitly?)
Notes: Culture 30° C

Pole cells carried into embryo by midgut invagination

Loss of K chromatids from somatic nuclei after pole cell formation
